meanings.sent1: She rescaled the map to make it fit on the page.
meanings.sent2: The tailor rescaled the dress to fit the customer perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally rescaled the recipe, ending up with a giant cake.
meanings.sent4: The architect rescaled the building plans, turning a small house into a mansion.
meanings.sent5: The artist rescaled the painting, making the mountains appear larger and more majestic.

meanings.definition: Changing the size or proportions of something
meanings.sent1: He rescaled the image to make it smaller for the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The gardener rescaled the garden layout to accommodate more plants.
meanings.sent3: The kids rescaled the game board, making it impossible to play.
meanings.sent4: The designer rescaled the logo, giving it a more modern look.
meanings.sent5: The scientist rescaled the graph, emphasizing the significant data points.
